DOCNAME: CASE OF NIKOGHOSYAN AND MELKONYAN v. ARMENIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in the village of GPE , ORG .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant PERSON ( hereafter , the second applicant ) instituted proceedings against a third person , PERSON , seeking pecuniary damages .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( NORP մարզի առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) granted his claim and ordered PERSON to pay CARDINAL NORP drams ( ORG ) ( TIME . QUANTITY ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( DEJA ) ( Դատական ակտերի հարկադիր կատարումն ապահովող ծառայություն ) instituted enforcement proceedings . On DATE , the ORG placed a seizure order on PERSON 's property , including land and cattle .
CARDINAL . On DATE the seized property was put on a public auction which took place on CARDINAL DATE . This property was bought by the second applicant .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , CARDINAL members of PERSON 's family instituted proceedings against the ORG . They claimed that the confiscated property had been jointly owned by them , but the ORG had failed to sever PERSON 's share when confiscating the property in question . They sought to annul the relevant acts and measures taken in the course of the enforcement proceedings , including the public auction . They also instituted proceedings against the second applicant , seeking to lift the seizure order over the property in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed their claim concerning the lifting of the seizure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant sold a part of the land in question jointly to the applicant PERSON ( hereafter , the first applicant ) and a third person , A.
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant and PERSON received a certificate of joint ownership in respect of the land .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the claim of PERSON 's family members against the ORG , finding that their property rights had been violated by the enforcement proceedings since the ORG should have severed and confiscated PERSON 's share in the property jointly owned by him and his family members instead of confiscating the entire property . ORG annulled the acts and measures taken in the course of the enforcement proceedings . No appeal was lodged against this judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ քաղաքացիական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարան ) quashed the judgment of DATE and lifted the seizure .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) upheld this judgment .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the members of PERSON 's family instituted proceedings against the applicants and A. seeking to annul the sales contract of DATE and the certificate of joint ownership of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted their claim and annulled these documents .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicants lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG , based in GPE , posted a summons addressed to both applicants , notifying them that the appeal hearing on the case would take place on DATE at TIME in GPE

CARDINAL . The envelope which contained the above summons had CARDINAL postmarks : CARDINAL dated DATE and put in GPE , and CARDINAL dated CARDINAL and DATE , both put in PERSON . On the front side of the envelope , in its lower left part , the second applicant wrote “ Received on DATE from the head of the post office ” .
CARDINAL . According to the applicants , this letter was received in GPE post office on DATE and was served on them on the same date .
CARDINAL . The Government contested this submission and claimed that the summons was timely delivered to the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the hearing as scheduled and decided to uphold the judgment of DATE . The plaintiff 's representative was present and made oral submissions and explanations . As regards the absence of the applicants , ORG stated that :
“ [ The applicants and A. ] received in person the summons notifying them about the place and time of the hearing , but they failed to appear . ”

CARDINAL . It appears that a copy of this judgment was sent to and received by the first applicant on DATE and DATE respectively . It further appears that the second applicant received a copy of this judgment in person at ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants lodged a cassation appeal in which they submitted , inter alia , that they had not been timely notified of the hearing of DATE and therefore had been unable to attend and make submissions . They argued that the summons had been served on them only on DATE which was confirmed by , inter alia , the relevant envelope .

CARDINAL . It appears that , since this cassation appeal was lodged out of time , attached to their appeal the applicants submitted a request to restore the missed time - limit for appeal . They allege that ORG granted this request on the ground that the summons in question had been served on them only on DATE . The applicants did not , however , submit a copy of such a decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined and dismissed the applicants ' cassation appeal in the absence of the parties and upheld the judgment of ORG . ORG in its decision did not touch upon the issue of the applicants ' absence from the hearing of DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ORG ) ( ՀՀ քաղաքացիական դատավարության օրենսգիրք ) read as follows :
“ Civil proceedings shall be conducted in an adversarial procedure and with respect for equality of arms . ”

“ CARDINAL . The parties have the right : ... ( CARDINAL ) to submit evidence and participate in its examination ... ; ( CARDINAL ) to ask questions , file motions and make explanations in court ; ( CARDINAL ) to submit their arguments concerning all issues raised during the court examination ; ( CARDINAL ) to object against the motions and arguments made by other parties ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The parties to civil proceedings ... are the plaintiff and the respondent .
CARDINAL . The parties enjoy equal procedural rights and bear equal procedural obligations . ”
“ CARDINAL . The parties to the proceedings shall be informed about the time and place of the court hearing ... by a court summons ...

CARDINAL . The summons shall be sent by registered post with acknowledgement of receipt or by other means of communication ensuring the registration of notification or is served against a receipt ( hereafter , duly notified ) . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP The clerk of the court hearing reports to the court about the presence of the parties and other participants of the proceedings and whether those who are absent have been duly notified , and also provides information about the reasons for their absence . ”
“ CARDINAL . NORP The non - appearance of the defendant who has been duly notified about the time and place of the court hearing shall not preclude the examination of the case . ”
“ CARDINAL . The court is entitled to adjourn the examination of the case if ... it can not be examined at the hearing in question because of the absence of CARDINAL of the parties ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The court of appeal shall adopt a decision to admit an appeal .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision should indicate the time and place of the court examination .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision shall be duly sent to the parties . ”
“ A cassation appeal can be lodged on ... points of law or a procedural violation of the parties ' rights ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A court judgment shall be ... quashed , if ... the case was examined in the absence of CARDINAL of the parties who had not been duly notified about the time and place of the hearing ... ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG is not entitled to establish or consider as proven circumstances which have not been established by the judgment [ of ORG ] or have been rejected by it , to determine whether or not this or that piece of evidence is trustworthy , to resolve the issue as to which piece of evidence has more weight or the issue as to which norm of substantive law must be applied and what kind of judgment must be adopted upon the new examination of the case . ”

“ CARDINAL . Judgments and decisions can be reviewed on the basis of new circumstances [ if ] ... a violation of a right ( rights ) guaranteed by an international convention to which GPE is a party has been found by a final judgment or decision of an international court ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the PERSON on ORG ( « Դատարանակազմության մասին ORG օրենք ) read as follows :
“ A court of appeal is the court which , on the basis of an appeal , carries out a fresh examination of the merits of the case which has been examined by the court of first instance .
The court of appeal is not constrained by the arguments raised in the appeal and can examine the case in its entirety ... ”
